briefdescription.para: Specify an alternative, renderer-specific type to use when emitting/translating this output, rather than translating based on its GetTypeName()

detaileddescription.para: For example, we set the renderType to "struct" for outputs that are of renderman custom struct types.

briefdescription.para: Return this output's specialized renderType, or an empty token if none was authored.
Return true if a renderType has been specified for this output.

sectiondef.header: API to author and query an Output's sdrMetadata

description.para: This section provides API for authoring and querying shader registry metadata on an Output.
When the owning shader prim is providing a shader definition, the authored "sdrMetadata" dictionary value provides metadata needed to populate the Output correctly in the shader registry.

We expect the keys in sdrMetadata to correspond to the keys in SdrPropertyMetadata. However, this is not strictly enforced by the API. The only allowed value type in the "sdrMetadata" dictionary is a std::string since it needs to be converted into a NdrTokenMap, which Sdr will parse using the utilities available in SdrMetadataHelpers.

briefdescription.para: Returns this Output's composed "sdrMetadata" dictionary as a NdrTokenMap.
Returns the value corresponding to key in the composed sdrMetadata dictionary.
Authors the given sdrMetadata value on this Output at the current EditTarget.
Sets the value corresponding to key to the given string value, in the Output's "sdrMetadata" dictionary at the current EditTarget.
Returns true if the Output has a non-empty composed "sdrMetadata" dictionary value.
Returns true if there is a value corresponding to the given key in the composed "sdrMetadata" dictionary.
Clears any "sdrMetadata" value authored on the Output in the current EditTarget.
Clears the entry corresponding to the given key in the "sdrMetadata" dictionary authored in the current EditTarget.
Speculative constructor that will produce a valid UsdShadeOutput when attr already represents a shade Output, and produces an invalid UsdShadeOutput otherwise (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the explicit bool conversion operator will return false).

briefdescription.para: Explicit UsdAttribute extractor.
Allow UsdShadeOutput to auto-convert to UsdAttribute, so you can pass a UsdShadeOutput to any function that accepts a UsdAttribute or const-ref thereto.
Return true if the wrapped UsdAttribute is defined, and in addition the attribute is identified as an output.
Test whether a given UsdAttribute represents a valid Output, which implies that creating a UsdShadeOutput from the attribute will succeed.

detaileddescription.para: Success implies that attr.IsDefined() is true.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether this Output can be connected to the given source attribute, which can be an input or an output.

detaileddescription.para: An output is considered to be connectable only if it belongs to a node-graph. Shader outputs are not connectable.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

briefdescription.para: Authors a connection for this Output.

detaileddescription.para: source is a struct that describes the upstream source attribute with all the information necessary to make a connection. See the documentation for UsdShadeConnectionSourceInfo. mod describes the operation that should be applied to the list of connections. By default the new connection will replace any existing connections, but it can add to the list of connections to represent multiple input connections.

simplesect.para: true if a connection was created successfully. false if shadingAttr or source is invalid.
This method does not verify the connectability of the shading attribute to the source. Clients must invoke CanConnect() themselves to ensure compatibility.
The source shading attribute is created if it doesn't exist already.

memberdef.argsstring: (UsdShadeConnectableAPI const &source, TfToken const &sourceName, UsdShadeAttributeType const sourceType=UsdShadeAttributeType::Output, SdfValueTypeName typeName=SdfValueTypeName()) const
memberdef.name: ConnectToSource

detaileddescription.para: DeprecatedThis is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

briefdescription.para: Authors a connection for this Output to the source at the given path.
Connects this Output to the given input, sourceInput.
Connects this Output to the given output, sourceOutput.
Connects this Output to the given sources, sourceInfos.
Finds the valid sources of connections for the Output.

detaileddescription.para: invalidSourcePaths is an optional output parameter to collect the invalid source paths that have not been reported in the returned vector.
Returns a vector of UsdShadeConnectionSourceInfo structs with information about each upsteam attribute. If the vector is empty, there have been no valid connections.

simplesect.para: A valid connection requires the existence of the source attribute and also requires that the source prim is UsdShadeConnectableAPI compatible.
The python wrapping returns a tuple with the valid connections first, followed by the invalid source paths.

xrefdescription.para: Returns the "raw" (authored) connected source paths for this Output.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if and only if this Output is currently connected to a valid (defined) source.
Returns true if the connection to this Output's source, as returned by GetConnectedSource(), is authored across a specializes arc, which is used to denote a base material.
Disconnect source for this Output.

detaileddescription.para: If sourceAttr is valid, only a connection to the specified attribute is disconnected, otherwise all connections are removed.

briefdescription.para: Clears sources for this Output in the current UsdEditTarget.

detaileddescription.para: Most of the time, what you probably want is DisconnectSource() rather than this function.

briefdescription.para: Find what is connected to this Output recursively.
Equality comparison.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if lhs and rhs represent the same UsdShadeOutput, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Inequality comparison.

detaileddescription.para: Return false if lhs and rhs represent the same UsdShadeOutput, true otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor returns an invalid Output.
Get the name of the attribute associated with the output.
Returns the name of the output.

detaileddescription.para: We call this the base name since it strips off the "outputs:" namespace prefix from the attribute name, and returns it.

briefdescription.para: Get the prim that the output belongs to.
Get the "scene description" value type name of the attribute associated with the output.
Set a value for the output.

detaileddescription.para: It's unusual to be setting a value on an output since it represents an externally computed value. The Set API is provided here just for the sake of completeness and uniformity with other property schema.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts. Set the attribute value of the Output at time.
Return true if this Output is valid for querying and authoring values and metadata, which is identically equivalent to IsDefined().
This class encapsulates a shader or node-graph output, which is a connectable attribute representing a typed, externally computed value.
